column4: Microsoft could lose out if it curbs sales in Russia: minister
column5: MOSCOW Microsoft could lose billions of dollars if it chooses to curb its sales in Russia due to U.S. sanctions  communications minister Nikolai Nikoforov was quoted by Russian news agencies as saying on Tuesday.

column4: U.S. cloud-computing failure could spur up to $19 bln in losses-Lloyd's
column5: Jan 23 A cyber problem that temporary shuts down a top U.S. cloud computing provider could trigger as much as $19 billion in business losses  only a fraction of which would be insured  Lloyd's of London said in a report on Tuesday.

column4: Microsoft could lose big if it curbs sales in Russia - minister
column5: MOSCOW  Jan 23 Microsoft could lose billions of dollars if it chooses to restrict its Russian clients due to sanctions  Russian communications minister Nikolai Nikoforov was quoted by local news agencies as saying on Tuesday.

column4: U.S. investigators to probe crash between Tesla vehicle  fire truck
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) said on Tuesday it was sending two investigators to examine the crash of a Tesla Inc  vehicle apparently traveling in semi-autonomous mode and a fire truck in California.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. investigators to probe crash between Tesla vehicle  fire truck
column5: WASHINGTON  Jan 23 The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) said on Tuesday it was sending two investigators to examine the crash of a Tesla Inc vehicle apparently traveling in semi-autonomous mode and a fire truck in California.

column4: Fine print in Trump solar tariff holds some good news for Tesla
column5: LOS ANGELES  Jan 23 Electric vehicle maker and solar installer Tesla Inc. said on Tuesday that it does not expect President Donald Trump's solar tariff to have much impact on its high-tech solar manufacturing ambitions  thanks to a clause exempting a vast amount of solar panel components from the levies.

column4: Tesla sets massive stock awards for Musk based on boosting market value
column5: BANGALORE/SAN FRANCISCO Silicon Valley billionaire Elon Musk could earn as much as $55.8 billion in Tesla Inc stock and own more than a quarter of the electric car company in the next decade if he hits all targets of a bold new pay plan. | Video

column4: Intel asks customers to halt patching for chip bug  citing flaw
column5: Intel Corp  said on Monday that patches it released to address two high-profile security vulnerabilities in its chips are faulty  advising customers  computer makers and cloud providers to stop installing them.

column4: Qualcomm set to be fined by EU antitrust regulators - FT
column5: Jan 23 The European Union is set to fine U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc for taking advantage of its dominance when it paid Apple Inc to use its chips exclusively in Apple mobile devices  The Financial Times reported on Tuesday.
